description:
Games can and do serve as a medium for
communicating philosophical ideas. For instance, what
is freedom? Are moral dilemmas possible? What is
reality? Equally, philosophy can shed light on the
nature of games. For instance, can games be art? What
is skill and luck? What is the nature of artificial
intelligence? This course will serve to explore some of
these issues, using games and philosophical texts in
tandem to explore various issues about what it is to be
a human, and what it is to be a gamer.
title: Games and Philosophy
